title: Sophomore Vol Jumper making leap to starting middle linebacker
content:
KNOXVILLE (WATE) – Walk-on sophomore Colton Jumper will get the start at middle linebacker when the Vols take the field Saturday at Nissan Stadium in Nasvhille. 
 
The walk-on from Chattanooga has been impressive in spring and fall workouts beating out freshman Darrin Kirkland Jr. and junior Kenny Bynum. 
 
“He’s really shown the level of consistency that we look for in a mike linebacker,” says defensive coordinator John Jancek. “He’s gotten better each an every day he’s been on the field.” 
 
Jumper will line up next to junior Jalen Reeves-Maybin who had 63 tackles for Tennessee in 2014. 
 
“He’s been preparing for it since the spring,” said Reeves-Maybin when asked about Jumper. “Me and him talk a lot. I’ve been telling him you got to be focused and prepare for it because when you’re name is called you got to live up to the expectations. We’ll all see Saturday that he’s prepared for it and he’s been working hard for it.” 
 
Saturday’s kick off between Tennessee and Bowling Green is set for 4 p.m. at Nissan Stadium in Nashville.
